result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic J Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Milwaukee Count Case 14CF1682

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Comply with the Drug and Alcohol Assessment and comply with any recommendations, up to agent to decide how to go forward. 
-Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic J Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominic J Williams appeared by video, in custody, Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Dominic J Williams.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-119 and 22CF-195.

9:03 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing.

Defense filed a waiver of right to personal appearance.
Court questions Defendant regarding appearance by video.
Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed electronically previously. Atty Soule provides a hard copy for the Court.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will plead to Count 4 in 22CF-195. Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in. 22CF-119 would be dismissed and read in.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF-195: Count 4: No Contest.

Defendant concurs of prior conviction.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney Soule for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 4 in 22CF-195.961.41(1m)(e)3
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
22CF-195: Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-119: Dismissed and read in.

There are no victim rights issues.

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court, this is a joint sentence recommendation.
Atty Soule makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF-195:
Count 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5 years 6 months.
Initial Confinement for 2 years 6 months.
Extended Supervision for 3 years. 
44 days credit to be applied towards the initial confinement.
Concurrent to the Milwaukee County Case 14CF-1682.
Eligible for Earned Release Program/Challenge Incarceration Program/Substance Abuse Program.
Conditions:
Comply with the Drug and Alcohol Assessment and comply with any recommendations, up to agent to decide how to go forward. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
pay court costs and surcharges.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance for 9/2/22 Plea/Sentencing filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 08/29/22 sp)
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 09/02/2022 at 09:00 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
/s/LJM 6/22/2022 - Approved.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Atty Pfeil will file informations consist with the charges in the complaint. 
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued in 22CF119.

Atty Pfeil requests a $1,000 signature bond in 22CF195.
Atty Soule requests a cash bond. 
Atty Pfeil does not object. 
Court notes he is not sure if he will get credit.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

4:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dominic J Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Dominic J Williams. 
Both files heard: 22CF119, 22CF195

Attorney/Defendant received copies of the criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dominic J Williams not in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Dominic J Williams. 
Both files heard: 22CF119, 22CF195

Atty Mutchler indicates that arrangements were made by the DA's office for the defendant to appear by video from Dodge Correctional.  Requests to adjourn to arrange for the defendant to appear by video.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order to Transport /s/ PB 05/24/22
Order to Transport.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
